overview_of_class: This course examines international politics from various perspectives ? theoretical, practical, historical, and more ? to address contemporary policy issues and controversies. Political life rests on a conventional distinction between international and domestic affairs, with national governments sovereign over domestic affairs and competing over international matters. Yet this distinction is challenged as globalization, ambiguity, and authority transcend the line between international and domestic politics. The class takes a broad look at global politics and at the conceptual resources with which these are understood
name: Introduction to International Relations
